April 2024 County of Marin EMS C 1
V-FIB/PULSELESS V-TACH
START MANUAL CPR
• Give O2 via BVM CRITICAL INFORMATION
• Attach monitor/defibrillator
• Compress at 100-120/min, 2”
• Apply defibrillator pads in anterior/posterior position
depth with full recoil of chest
• IV/IO access
• Mechanical CPR for transport
⚡ Airway Management
• BLS airway preferred during first
CPR 2 min
5 minutes
• Do not interrupt CPR for >10
seconds for intubation
No
• Use continuous ETCO2
Shockable Rhythm?
Drug Therapy.
⚡
• If ROSC after Amiodarone,
consider Amiodarone drip
CPR 2 min
150mg in 100ml NS, 1mg/min =
• Consider advanced airway
40gtts/min with 60gtt/ml tubing
Go to Policy:
• If hyperkalemia is suspected in
• Asystole/PEA, renal dialysis patients, give 1
C 2
• Epinephrine (0.1mg/ml) gram of 10% Calcium
1mg IV/IO • ROSC, C 10 Chloride IV/IO and 50mEq of
• Repeat every 3-5min
Sodium Bicarbonate IV/IO
• Max: 3 doses
Reversible Causes
• Hypovolemia
No • Hypoxia
Shockable Rhythm?
• Hydrogen Ion (Acidosis)
• Hypo/Hyperkalemia
⚡
• Hypothermia
• Tension Pneumothorax
CPR 2 min
• Tamponade (cardiac)
• Treat reversible causes
• Toxins
• Thrombus
• Amiodarone 300mg IV/IO
• Repeat in 3-5min 150mg
☎
• PHYSICIAN CONSULT to
transport rVF patients with: age
>75yrs, terminal diagnosis,
If VF/pVT after 3rd Shock unwitnessed arrest, non-cardiac
etiology (known or suspected)
Apply additional set of defibrillation
pads in standard (apical) placement
⚡
If VF/pVT after 4th Shock
• If not already in place, apply Mechanical CPR device
• Transport to SRC
